comments:

asking me to choose a process. Unfortunately, this list is always empty.

If I instead press OK, the log contains a NPE. (Hint: OK should be disabled if 
the list is empty. ;-))
Could you please take a look at this.

Windows XP is currently the only Windows platform which supports this
as it ships with a command line utility which provides this info.  If
someone has win32 api experience and would like to contribute to the CDT,
I would be happy to intergate any patches.  

I'm not even sure the best approch to make this work, whether it uses a seperate 
util which supports all win32 platforms or use some JNI to make this work... 
comments?

Why not using the cygwin ps util, if you need an external tool (and all that 
you need is process IDs)? In practice, you need to have cygwin installed if to 
run CDT on Windows...

The core CDT does not require cygwin, therefore should not depend on
cywin utils. We need to provide a way that does not have an external
dependancy such as JNI or a hand crafted win32 util.
Alain is currently working to resolve this.

Code is in CVS to get this working.  Of course the user
should attach with a program that the underlying debugger
understands(GDB only understand Cygwin).

Not sure if this will make it for CDT_1_1 there is not
enough incentive for it.

State change as fix
